Good radar app. The normal radar view doesn't have the resolution I need. However, the wind velocity display is excellent! I now use this almost exclusively for the relative wind velocity data, during severe weather events.

replyContent: We very sorry that it wasn't more clear. You don't have to subscript to Allison House except for certain features. And, we always offer refunds for situations like that, if you would like one.

content: Great app, Is it possible to add more color tables?

content: The best now Caprockweather discontinued their PYKL3Radar app. One issue is that there is no option to override screen timeout.
replyContent: Thank you for your review. You can override screen timeout with LONG-PRESS -> Quick Menu -> Keep Screen ON.

content: Hands down the best, buy it u will love it

Pro radar app that shows you the actual radar data, without smoothing. Maybe not everyone will like it, but I think it's great. I especially like the direction & speed tracks. I understand that the crashing problems a few others have found should now be fixed.
Not updated in months. Clunky, dated user interface. RadarScope and Radar Omega are frequently updated and better for me.
Works ok, but color scheme and UI not that great.
replyContent: The color scheme is that used by the National Weather Service, since many of the users are professionals. The UI is a matter of taste, of course - this was done to be extremely flexible, which comes at a bit of a cost in learning. It is described in the help that you can get from the menus.

content: absolute best radar app out there. worth every penny.

Haven't had any real problems with us and with the storm right now is just funky. Really great with warnings that just pop up around the storms. content: How do you get an Allison House subscription!
replyContent: You go to allisonhouse.com.

content: this app is very good excellent quality great service willing to work are you even I had an issue with one of my tablets it wasn't their fault found that it was a tablet fault they make suggestions and so does the dealer returning the tablet I think when people reach out from the company like this and help you they have a real good attitude towards their product which I think is fantastic

This app has very good potential, but lacks in detail. The radar appears good and option to get fast updates as they become available. Option to setup different layers for different situations is excellent. Similar to the Pykl3 app, which is what many are looking for. Map display, such as roads, are very poor and appears old. Radar data is very pixelated and appears old style, also lacks smoothing option. Hope there is some upgrades and improvements soon.
replyContent:
Hi, thank you for purchasing the product.

The map display is low detail to reduce memory usage and download time.

 I do not smooth radar data, as that reduces the accuracy - things look prettier but are not accurate. Also, that turns out to be computationally intensive.

I am always making improvements.

content: I love this app, but i have question, why it is saying "Tilt Not Available in Clear Air Mode" when i put base reflectivity .9 248?
my refund didnt have stuff i want lightning not there and want refund back sucks
replyContent:
Lightning is available as a paid option, because lightning data is not free, and a one time payment for an app cannot possibly fun it. I offer quick refunds, and you can get a refund from the play store.

The app has many features, and I use it myself for storm chasing. I am sorry you don't like it, but my thousands of users don't think it "sucks."

content: Better radar than most weather apps

Sorry for the inconvenience. Our provider changed where we get the data. The app has now been updated, and yours should now work if you have updated it to version 5.1.0. Support is available from within the app, and on the web site.

I cannot email you because you have not provided an email address. Please - use the support dialog.

Radar Alive is the best radar app I've used, and by a pretty significant margin. It's lightweight, quick to load, and manages to be both versatile and accessible. The controls are fluid and intuitive. The interface isn't flashy: RA's priorities are clearly centered on meeting the needs of the many kinds of people looking for a reliable mobile radar. It's a tool, not a style-piece. Updates are prompt for such a small project. Super grateful this app exists. Thanks much to those who work on it.

Been using this app for years and it's always provided quick accurate information. The recent radar display issues, related to a change made by the NWS, have been quickly fixed and everything is working correctly. Replies for support/questions about the app have been answered quickly. Thanks

I am sorry for the inconvenience and that you didn't get my response. It has been re-sent with this info.. I have been able to fix the problem and re-release the app. The source of radar data changed how to get it, and I did not get the notification until too late. I am the developer.

I always respond to report requests as soon as possible.

content: Brilliant!!!!

Opens FAST. Provides up to date radar about what you need to know .......NOW! I love that this app has so many visual settings, so that you can customize to suit your eyes. Do you want to see more or less, and what color or thickness of state, county, road and interstate lines, radar paths, etc! Do you want to see more or less cities labled? How fast you want to loop, how often to check your gps location, and more. And.....it's FREE! Thank you!

Program works great, Radar + METAR is something I have not seen offered (out of the box and/or for free) for most programs.   As for the reviews complaining about the "8 bit graphics" if you look at any radar program used in the field for meteorology, and/or storm chasers you will notice that is what all the radar products look like (PKYL3, RadarScope, GRlevel2, GRLevel3, et al) This provides better resolution and is closer to what is really going on and what the radar it self "sees" compared to the super processed radar like you would see on Weather Nation, Weather Underground, The Weather Channel etc.   When you make everything super smooth you lose resolution and may miss vital details in the radar output.   My only complaint is that it does not include Level II Radar (has higher resolution) which RadarScope offers, and it lacks  Radar Level IV Data (such as Tornado Vortex signatures)    PKYL3 and Radarscope cost 10 dollars, where as this is half that price  It is a great value and (for me) the biggest selling point is the METAR data that is included. I will be using this alongside RadarScope and GRlevel2AE regularly.

If you want a great radar with quickly updated radar images, this is for you. The best technical radar app also I owe most of what I know about storm structure and radar of it to this app. Very great app
I have been using this app for over a year. It's great for a novice storm chaser. Recently had an issue with the app, and the developer support was outstanding.

The app has lots of different radars, but they need to work on quality of the radar graphics. Then again maybe that's the way there supposed to be. It does what it states and I needed just an accurate radar map, and it does that.

I cannot get any data, it says "radar site down"
replyContent: This radar data comes from the National Weather service, and originates at radar sites around the country. When those radars go down - either they break or NWS takes them down for service - Radar Alive Pro reports that so you will know that the data is out of data. Try switchign to a different radar site that isn't down at the same time.

Ok now that I have used this app for a while I will give my honest opinion. There is no app on Android that is better! I live in Montana and we've had some very severe thunderstorms lately. I was able to track and warn my daughter who lives in the mtns to the west. I told her of the severity even before the NWS gave a warning! With dual-pol I was able to see exactly where the hail was falling! With storm tracks and weather spotter info (which pykl3 and RadarScope don't have) this is an invaluable tool!
Good radar app but radars for Nebraska have been down for months
Love it. Very user friendly, but drained and will drain battery if your monitoring a storm.
replyContent:
Radar Alive Pro offers special options to help minimize battery drain, such as optimized GPS polling and internet usage.

I do supply a "keep screen on" option which will drain battery more quickly. Users with battery issues should use that option sparingly.

I doubt you can find a wx app that does better on battery.

content: I got PYKL3,  Radar Scope,  and now this one. All great radar apps this one is most user friendly due to the excellent hint tutorial that walks you through it all.
Best radar app I have found!!
i love this app blows the others i have out of the water if you like lots of good info you gotta get this app

This is so inaccurate! I have PYKL and RadarScope so if you're serious about weather don't waste your time with this. I hate giving bad reviews but this app is just not working for me. Shows a storm when skies are clear. Sorry dev... really am.
replyContent:
The most likely problem is that the NOAA server is out of date. They have been having intermittent troubles lately. I offer support and refunds for anyone with problems, and rarely have had someone ask for a refund. I am sorry you didn't avail yourself of that support.

This app is working for thousands of people. I use it myself for storm chasing.

content: this is a great app. I have never had any problems with start-up, force closes, or the data link. Also there are plenty of radar scans to choose from. I especially like the echo tops option. Great job! I might suggest adding a lighting strike option though.
This is a great app especially for weather geeks like me! The developer works hard on adding awesome improvements. Worth way, way more than what it costs!!!!
Accurate, current, easy to use. Live in Iowa, use it daily especially during the summer.

Paid $6.95 to install and  deleted it an hour later...the images of the radar are pixilated and blocky. Seemingly only gave me options for the center of the radar sweep 100 miles south or east of my local position... Had great luck  for a year or so with a $10 version of Weather Pro, until a new update reconfigured the layout making there program look like an old blocky Atari game as well. The search continues for a detailed Android App for radar specifically
replyContent: Radar Alive Pro produces the most accurate display possible from the government's Level III data. It shows data from one radar at a time with the center at the actual radar, as described in its market literature. RAP's focus is on accurate data rather than aesthetics.

content: Well worth the cost. And I'm a pretty cheap guy. Lol. If you're always checking the weather and looking at radar like I am, you need this app. Plus the guy who developed it is great at customer service. I emailed him and got a response in 15 minutes.
Been getting a lot of product stale at site notifications. Please fix.
replyContent: So you will know when the data you see is out of date, the application tells you that the data is stale. The stale data was caused by a problem with the National Weather Service servers  (June 17th outage) and not that of the application. Sorry for the inconvenience, but the problem is not with the app.

content: Gives excellent radar images. Easy to switch between radar sites. Does not consume your battery. Great customization features.
Awesome! Best radar app out there. Wouldnt mind seeing smoothing as one of the options even though I know its not as accurate. Best ive seen! Good stuff!
Only wish the radar was not blocky, I guess radar technology has not grown out of the block stage into a real "photo" type.  Maybe 1 day..
replyContent: The radar quality is what the NWS provides for level III data. Serious radar apps use this resolution - same blockiness. Some can smooth it, making it prettier but less accurate. Please feel free to ask for a refund. I have button in the app, and a website where you can find help, and get  support or request a refund - even after 15 minutes..

content: This is a very good very good weather apps
Really worth the money. I've had it over a year & would buy it again today.
Very good
Very excellent radar app and presentation. The developer is very quick to respond and fix issues that arise. I highly recommend this app for all weather enthusiasts.
great app. being a chaser i depend on my mobile radar greatly. when im not chasing yet still using radar i see warnings a few mins before the news anounces them. 5/5 star radar
Excellent radar app.
Love this app! Fast rendering and excellent radar options!!!

This is the best radar app I've tried, hands down. This is exactly what I've been looking for after being disappointed with other radar apps! This is the kind of app that makes having a smartphone so useful and worthwhile. Thank you to the dev for the work you put into this.
Extremely accurate and handy when out chasing severe weather. Worth every cent.
Life Saver for us living in North Oklahoma when electricity goes out during a super cell.
Very nice App. A must have for a serious storm chaser. Or someone looking for more detailed radar and it's fast! Author of program is very helpful if you have a question.
Maps update quickly, very accurate!
Great!

This is an app for people who want to study the raw data and draw their own insights. The data are presented in beautiful maps but it will take you a fair amount of study to know what the maps represent. You will learn a lot of Meteorology, which is great. You may get better insights than your TV weatherman, and there are user groups and forums to help you learn.
Touch a storm and you will see how far away it is. I use this feature all the time to estimate ETA.
Fully featured, frequently updated, very useful. Well worth purchase price.
App is great but the radar sensitivity doesn't remember it's settings and always goes to the highest sensitivity
Almost perfect in such a simple app. Keep up the good work!

This little app is probably the most overlooked weather radar app I have ever used. Its simple straight forward display is so flexible and it is very easy to decifer. Best one for the price by far. And no ads!
I like to see what's comming. We had two severe storms and knocked power out  some people are still without you need a good radar to see what's up.
Great App!  It would be great if you had aHD mode!  I look forward to many more updates!!  Great Job !!!!
greedy yanky
replyContent: Different countries have different radar standards, availability and audiences. I think it's unfair to downrate this application because it only shows US radars. That's where the most radars and viewers are. I would have been glad to offer a refund if you had asked.

content: This is a great radar app for quick up to the minute radar images.
Its the best weather app out there.
Paid for this app but it will not install. Keep getting error and it will not le me get a refund on this either. Sucky app don't waste time or money. Hope there is a -5 rating on here.
replyContent: I offer help on the web site and through the app. I would be glad to refund your money if we can't get the app to work for you.

content: Sucks big time! (ONLY) because it only loads 1 radar site???!  WTF? So much for tracking anything coming through. CANNOT TRACK ANYTHING as it goes through your state. Don't SPEND the money. Free appear have BETTER COVERAGE.
replyContent: I'm sorry you are disappointed. This app is typical of those used by professionals and serious enthusiasts. By offering one radar site at a time, it saves bandwidth and allows more detailed display for that site. I would be happy to offer you a refund if you ask.

content: This app its amazing !!!! thanks guys!!!!

This is a great radar app! I like it much better than Radar Now. It loads superfast & is always up to date. It is more pixelated than I would like & it would be nice to touch radar sites to change instead of using the menu, but those are minor things.

Fast,  clean,  excellent.   As good as,  or better than any of the other radar apps.    Lots of options,  good user interface and quite dependable.    Only thing missing,  and developer says it is coming soon,  is dual-pol products.

Lots of map options. Cool colors on black background make this app functional and user friendly. County & state borders, interstate & other roads can be customized for color & thickness. Location updates often. I like Pykl3 a little better.

Best app on the market, "it works perfectly and has intelligent features".  I was comparing the data samples against PYKL3 Radar & Radar Scope.  Radar Alive was between 4 & 6 minutes more up to date.  In fact the data I was getting was only 4 to 6 minutes old as to the other programs being 8 to 12 minutes old.  Also, when you pause a storm animation it takes you to the latest update time, this is a very nice feature because from there you can see how far out the storm is...

Of all the radar apps for Android, I like this one the best. Yes, it has a few shortcomings (missing legend, no range rings, no radar images prior to app start), but I'm excited for the potential for this app. The developer seems to listen to his customers, and that's a great thing. It has a complete set of advanced radar modes, which is excellent. And I have no issues running it on my "antiquated" Droid 1. I highly recommend it for weather enthusiasts who need more than what TWC and Weatherbug apps show.
Best radar app on the market for my needs. Only problem is that I can't get the animation (loop) to work, when it does I only get 2 frames.
